fields.description:
When creating an anchor based link, if the target anchor is on a page which contains a table of contents (TOC) the link will bring us to the table of contents and not the intended anchor.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a new page (parent), multiple pages long to express the issue
# Create an anchor at the bottom of the parent page
# Create a heading anywhere on the parent page (to populate the TOC)
# Create a TOC at the top of the parent page
# Create another page (child)
# Create a link to the anchor on the parent page as describered [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF51/Working+with+Anchors#WorkingwithAnchors-Creatingalinktoananchor]
# Once both pages are saved, click the link on the child page and notice that we are directed to the TOC and not the anchor as intended
fields.summary: Table of contents interferes with anchor links

fields.description:
h4. The problem
Suppose that in Confluence 3.5.x or prior, USER A and USER B are both editing _version 1_ of a given page. USER A creates a draft based on _version 1_, and USER B actually saves the page, bumping the page up to _version 2_.

If this instance were to be upgraded to Confluence 4 or higher, these drafts will throw stacktraces when the user tries to use the "Resume Conflicted" option to resume editing.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# On Confluence 3.5.x or earlier, create a blank test page with one line of text.
# Using USER A, edit the page, change the text, but don't save it. This will create a draft user USER A.
# Using USER B, edit the page, change the text, and save the page. This will create a conflict between USER A's draft page and the updated page, since the draft was based off of an older version.
# Upgrade to Confluence 4.x or higher.
# View USER A's drafts, and click the "Resume Conflicted"

h4. Expected behavior
The draft page will be compared with the current version of the page, showing the content that will be overwritten if the draft were saved.

h4. Actual behavior
Confluence throws the following error: 
{code}
2013-08-09 15:01:29,298 WARN [http-5437-6] [confluence.velocity.introspection.AnnotationBoxingUberspect] lookupMethod Velocity template accessing deprecated method com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultDraftManager#getMergedContent - /users/viewmydrafts.vm[line 70, column 68]
 -- referer: http://localhost:5437/dashboard.action | url: /users/viewmydrafts.action | userName: usera | action: viewmydrafts

	at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Processor.process(Http11Processor.java:859)
	at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol$Http11ConnectionHandler.process(Http11Protocol.java:588)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.JIoEndpoint$Worker.run(JIoEndpoint.java:489)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:680)
{code}

It's worth noting that despite the error above, both the old draft and the current page version have been converted to XHTML. The 'bodytypeid' of the BODYCONTENT table shows a value of "2" (denoting XHTML storage format) for both the draft and current page.

h4. Workaround
If possible, resolve these conflicts prior to the upgrade. The following SQL query will help you identify all drafts based on outdated page versions.

(!) The tricky part about this query is in line 3. You must cast the 'draftpageid' column into data type to match the data type of 'contentid' column. Exactly how to do this casting will depend on what database you are using. The below example is for Postgres, where the 'draftpageid' data type is normally VARCHAR(255) but has been cast into BIGINT to match 'contentid':
{code:sql}
SELECT c1.creator, s.spacekey, c1.title, c1.draftpageversion, c2.version
FROM CONTENT c1
JOIN CONTENT c2 ON cast(c1.draftpageid AS bigint) = c2.contentid
JOIN SPACES s ON c2.spaceid = s.spaceid
WHERE c1.contenttype = 'DRAFT' AND c1.draftpageversion != c2.version;
{code}

If you have already upgraded to Confluence 4+, you will need to discard these drafts (Profile > Drafts > Discard).
fields.summary: Draft pages based on outdated page versions are broken after upgrading to Confluence 4 or higher

Here is a step to reproduce the issue: 
# Install a new Confluence instance 5.1.1
# Create a new space and a new page with the attachment macro
# Attach a text file.
# Change the text file content, then attach the same file again.
# When open the attachment version history looks like the page:
!Screen Shot 2013-08-12 at 11.52.47 AM.png!
Which is not showing as expected like: 
!Screen Shot 2013-08-13 at 9.25.06 AM.png!

There might be possible consequence: 
# The AJAX call might be timeout as some Confluence had complicate decorator / customization.
# The version history can be shown for only one attachment file.
# The version history is loading very slow when having a lot of version.

*Workaround solution:* Please update the attachment plugin to the version 3.6.7 or later:
https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/confluence.extra.attachments

*Steps to reproduce* :

Mark several horizontally neighbouring cells and press "Del" on the keyboard.
*Expected result*: The content of these cells would be removed
*Actual result*: The cells themselves are removed and the row has now fewer columns than the other rows.

This happens only on Firefox.
I tested with 22.0

PDF export OOMEs for deeply nested ordered lists

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30340].
  {panel}

The editor currently emits overly complex DOM fragments to represent an indent list. This can easily provoke OOMEs when performing a PDF export of the page containing such a fragment.

E.g. if you insert an (ordered) list in the editor, add and entry and indented it via tab the output will be a nested (ordered) list. 

It is enough to place 22 tabs on the list item to cause an OOME if you export the resulting page as PDF.

!Selection_102.png|thumbnail!

My test setup was a vanilla 5.2.2 instance against HSQLDB with _-Xmx1G -XX:MaxPermSize=256M_.

{code}
Server version: Apache Tomcat/6.0.35
Server built:   Dec 8 2012 11:07:24
Server number:  6.0.35.0
OS Name:        Linux
OS Version:     3.8.0-19-generic
Architecture:   amd64
JVM Version:    1.7.0_25-b15
JVM Vendor:     Oracle Corporation
{code}

Now I understand that this is really a problem of the PDF export (for which I'm going to raise a separate issue), but I believe the editor should make it an effort to use CSS instructions instead of DOM elements to reach the desired effect.
fields.summary: Improve emitted DOM for indented lists

In my confluence structure we have parent pages and child pages. The parent pages are just for organizational purposes, and do not contain any meaningful content beyond a page tree macro. Because new page creations do not have the option to turn notifications off, users will receive notifications when this structural page is created. fields.description:
I have a space that I created ( I am the confluence admin) at one time it had the space and all child pages restricted to a subset of users. 

I now want it available to the general public. 

I went into the Space Admin, Restricted Pages and clear out all the pages with restrictions and saved.. during the save our server encountered a crash due to out of memory.

When I revived the server.. I go back to the space.. all restrictions are gone.. but on the Space home page, the lock still shows up telling me the restrictions are there.. I look again. None to be found. 

Also.. now .. I can not edit the space home page and the only people who can are the people who were NOT in the original group that had access.  Its almost like it has restricted those who were originally authorized. 

Tried to log this via the support mechanism in our version but it gets internal system error.

Are there DB tables or Config files I can look at to clear the restrictions on that space manually?

fields.description:
h3.Problem
When migrating or moving Confluence from one URL, either OnDemand or another Confluence, it continues to use the Referrer from the other site, even if this new Confluence is not reachable from that URL.

h3.Workaround
Go to Page Information, and locate the Hot Referrers URL:
# Go to the desired Page
# Tools > Page Information
# Copy the URL, example.atlassian.com
# Go to Confluence Administration
# Manage Referrers
# Paste this copied url to "Exclude External Referrers" and add http:// in front
# Click Add
# Then Click Purge All
# And then Delete this URL.
# Done
fields.summary: Hot Referrers are not Clean upon Export

fields.description:
I found this issue when pasting a gpg ascii armored from my terminal into a noformat block, pulling it back out and attempting to import it on another system.

It would appear that the noformat and code blocks truncate a single newline in double newline situations which made the gpg key invalid and unable to import.

I looked at the hex values to make sure i wasn't crazy:

content on original system:
{noformat}
0000000: 2d2d 2d2d 2d42 4547 494e 2050 4750 2050  -----BEGIN PGP P
0000010: 5542 4c49 4320 4b45 5920 424c 4f43 4b2d  UBLIC KEY BLOCK-
0000020: 2d2d 2d2d 0a56 6572 7369 6f6e 3a20 476e  ----.Version: Gn
0000030: 7550 4720 7631 2e34 2e35 2028 474e 552f  uPG v1.4.5 (GNU/
0000040: 4c69 6e75 7829 0a0a 6d51 4769 4245 2f49  Linux)..mQGiBE/I
0000050: 354c 4d52 4241 4350 7150 686c 524d 462f  5LMRBACPqPhlRMF/
0000060: 4e63 6938 526c 386a 2b6c 7550 6654 4f31  Nci8Rl8j+luPfTO1
{noformat}

gpg key after pasting into and copying out of a noformat macro:
{noformat}
0000000: 2d2d 2d2d 2d42 4547 494e 2050 4750 2050  -----BEGIN PGP P
0000010: 5542 4c49 4320 4b45 5920 424c 4f43 4b2d  UBLIC KEY BLOCK-
0000020: 2d2d 2d2d 0a56 6572 7369 6f6e 3a20 476e  ----.Version: Gn
0000030: 7550 4720 7631 2e34 2e35 2028 474e 552f  uPG v1.4.5 (GNU/
0000040: 4c69 6e75 7829 0a6d 5147 6942 452f 4935  Linux).mQGiBE/I5
0000050: 4c4d 5242 4143 5071 5068 6c52 4d46 2f4e  LMRBACPqPhlRMF/N
0000060: 6369 3852 6c38 6a2b 6c75 5066 544f 3153  ci8Rl8j+luPfTO1S
{noformat}

Steps to reproduce:
1. in your favorite text editor type in anything separated by two newlines:
{code}
foo

bar
{code}
2. Paste that in to a noformat or code block.
3. copy back out into favorite text editor.

Expected outcome: all newlines preserved
Actual outcome: single newline truncated

Editing the source and inserting a newline inside the norformat block works around the issue.

fields.description:
When disable Quick Navigation, the autocomplete would not work for some part of Confluence. This include when you move issue and in the Advanced window, although the page is there, it would show drop down with "No matching pages found." or "No matching spaces found"  when you try to search although the pages or spaces is there. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create 2 pages named page 1 and page 2
# Disable Quick Navigation in General Configuration
# Go into page 1 and select "Move" option
# In the "Move Page" dialog - Advanced option, copy paste the name "page 1" and paste in the full name of the page
# The New Parent Page will give drop down "No matching pages found."
# When you click move, the page will actually move.

h3. Actual Result:
It would show drop down with "No matching pages found." or "No matching spaces found" 

h3. Expected Result:
It would be better to do one of the following so it wouldn't give user the wrong direction:
* Show error message that Quick Navigation is disabled
* Hide the drop down box.
* Provide user an option to search with message such as "Search for XXXXX page"

h3. Notes:
The same behaviour applies when you move the pages to a new space. Tested with Confluence demo page as following:
!search_message.png|thumbnail!

  {panel}

h4. Migrated from https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/USERLISTER-12

_Note_: Needs heavy refactoring

Here's my suggestions for improvement: 

* There's no need to loop through the entire list of users if we only online only. Just loop through online users. 
* Move comparator logic into {{ListedUser}} (implement {{Comparable}} - sort by online/offline then by Fullname)
* Use a {{TreeSet}} to store the list of {{ListedUser}}'s (so there's no need to sort after)
* get rid of {{UserList}} and replace with {{OnlineUserListManager}}
* {{getUsersByGroup}} cannot continue to return either a list of {{User}}'s or usernames. 
* {{ListedUser}} rename to {{OnlineStatusAwareUser}}

{{OnlineUserListManager}}
* {{getUserList(Status all/online/offline, Set<Group> groups)}}
** online only
*** loop through online username list
** online in a group(s)
*** get aggregated member names for all groups (1 per group) and intersect with online usernames 
** all in a group(s) 
*** loop through all users in group (deactivation check?)

All the above three cases produce a list of candidate usernames which you can then fetch the user for and construct a {{ListedUser}}. 

The last case, involves actually looping through {{User}}'s objects 
* all users with confluence access
** loop through all users and do online check

We desperately need some sort of pagination for all of the above. But that's out of scope.
fields.summary: Add user list pagination in user lister macro

h4. Migrated from https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/USERLISTER-26

Dear Jonathan Nolen,
we - AUDI AG - want to use your Userlister plugin in our Confluence 4.3.3, to show our customers which users are listed in which group in their spaces.
We have round about 120 different spaces. Most of them have got different groups and different users.
We'd like to provide our customer an easy view of which users have access to their spaces.
Unfortunately our customers have no access to the space administration.
As we really like to give them the opportunity to see their space permissions, we'd like to user your userlister plugin.
Is it possible for you to implement Bob Swifts macro security as described here (https://bobswift.atlassian.net/wiki/display/LIBSEC/Macro+Security+Library+for+Confluence) so only system administrators are allowed to use this plugin via security macro setting?
Best wishes and thx for paying attention.
Christopher Jaksch

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30268].
  {panel}

*Context*
We have a large number (100 or so) of spaces that we create for our clients where we put information only relevant to them and not other clients. The information in these spaces are managed by a number of our client-facing teams, such as account managers and project managers.

However, sometimes a new group (managed by LDAP) of users needs to be able to update information in all of these spaces and I currently have to run through each of these spaces manually, updating the permissions for each one. This is very time consuming.

*Solution*
Allow me to create schema that I can apply to multiple spaces so that updating the permissions on these spaces can be done centrally and once.

Note that these schema should allow me to set additional permissions on a space. For example, all client spaces should have the "clientspace" schema applied to it but I should also be able to manually add that "bobscountrybunker" can view the "Bob's Country Bunker" space that has this schema applied to it.

It would also be beneficial for me to able to add multiple schema to a space.

*Notes*
You could say that perhaps we should manage this through better group management (e.g., create a group that can specifically edit client spaces and then put all users in that group) but Confluence does not allow for nested groups in group management. In an organisation with hundreds of employees, I may end up spending an equal amount of time managing the users in the group rather than the individual space permissions.

Furthermore, I'm sure you'll agree that this functionality would have a far greater positive impact than the specific use case I have provided.
fields.summary: Allow space permissions to be managed by schema so updating access to multiple spaces is simple

The widget macro does not allow https macros for wufoo forms (which is the URL format suggested by wufoo).

If you try using an https URL, the macro doesn't render. You have to use the http URL.

This is particularly problematic for CAC on IE, as you get mixed content warnings (since CAC is served over https, but there is an http wufoo form)

There are also customer complaints about this: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Widget+Connector+Macro?focusedCommentId=183468349#comment-183468349

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30255].
  {panel}

When trying to add a Confluence page to a JIRA dashboard via the 'Confluence Page Gadget', typing the name of a Confluence space on the 'Space' field, or the name of a Confluence page on the 'Page' field returns suggestions of Confluence spaces/pages available, however, clicking on any of the suggestions does not select the suggestion to be shown on the gadget, instead, the clicked suggestion will open on Confluence. Not being possible to configure the gadget.

Steps to reproduce:
# Add the 'Confluence Page Gadget' on a JIRA dashboard.
# Start typing the name of an existing space/page on the corresponded field.
# Click on any of the suggestions for the typed text.

h4. Added by [~jgarcia] 22-08-13:
{quote}h5. Steps to Reproduce:
- Create a JIRA 5.2.4.1, Confluence 5.2.3
- Create Trusted application link
-- Confluence uses JIRA for User Admin
- Create page
- Get Confluence Page Gadget URL from Help menu

h5. What I'm doing:
- Add Gadget to JIRA
- Type in the first few letters of my page name so it's visible in the drop-down
- Click to select from dropdown

h5. What I expect as a result:
- The page name and link is automagically inserted into the field

h5. The actual result:
- The page specified in the dropdown loads, consuming the whole browser window and leaving JIRA.

h5. Tested on:
- Chrome 29, Opera 12, IE9
- ArchLinux/Postgres/Standalone
- JIRA 5.2.4.1/Confluence 5.2.3

h5. Browser console:
{noformat}--
[11:39:12.255] TypeError: l.always is not a function @ http://kidney.staff.sf.atlassian.com:9523/523/s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e/en_GB-1988229788/4394/a32f094df7825f58c6a417309475c6c954804a27.1/1.0/_/download/batch/confluence.web.components:core/confluence.web.components:core.js:91
[11:39:12.312] GET http://kidney.staff.sf.atlassian.com:9524/5241/plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest?refresh=3600&url=http%3A%2F%2Fkidney.staff.sf.atlassian.com%3A9523%2F523%2Frest%2Fprototype%2F1%2Fsearch%2Fname.json%3Ftype%3Dpage%252Cblogpost%26query%3Dtest&httpMethod=GET&headers=&postData=&authz=&st=&contentType=JSON&numEntries=3&getSummaries=false&signOwner=true&signViewer=true&gadget=http%3A%2F%2Fkidney.staff.sf.atlassian.com%3A9523%2F523%2Frest%2Fgadgets%2F1.0%2Fg%2Fcom.atlassian.confluence.plugins.gadgets%3Aconfluence-page-gadget%2Fgadgets%2Fconfluence-page-gadget.xml&container=atlassian&bypassSpecCache= [HTTP/1.1 200 OK 120ms]
[11:39:12.386] ReferenceError: _ is not defined @ http://kidney.staff.sf.atlassian.com:9523/523/s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e/en_GB-1988229788/4394/a32f094df7825f58c6a417309475c6c954804a27.1/1.0/_/download/batch/confluence.web.components:core/confluence.web.components:core.js:25{noformat}

If there's an error in the way I've set it up, then please consider this a feature request for the error to be logged.{quote}


h4.Workaround (courtesy of [~eirik1])
# Right Click on the “Page”-input-textbox in the Gadget-form, and choose “Inspect Element”;
# The input-element will be selected in the “Elements”-tab in Developer Tools;
# A few lines above the selected element, you will find two hidden inputs:
a. {noformat}<input id="pageId" type="hidden" name="pageId" value>{noformat}
b. {noformat}<input id="pageName" type="hidden" name="pageName" value>{noformat}
# Doubleclick on the value-attribute of the pageId-element, and change the attribute to {noformat}value=”[ID of confluence document]”{noformat}
# Doubleclick on the value-attribute of the pageName-element, and change the attribute to {noformat}value=”[Name of the confluence document]”{noformat} (might not be necessary). Click outside the element to “save” the value;
# Click _Save_ in the Gadget-wizard.

The Confluence Page ID can be found *Tools > Page Information* in Confluence, or in the query string of the Page's URL.

(i) For additional details about how to apply the workaround, please check this [video|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/101801/confluence_page_gadget.mp4]
fields.summary: Unable to select 'Space' or 'Page' or on Confluence Page Gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30236].
  {panel}

Administrators should have an easy way to force users to change passwords in bulk format in emergencies. 

Has this been discussed as a possible feature?
Are there drawbacks to having a mass password reset force in administration?

Would setting password expiration to 1 (day) expire all passwords in 24 hours? Is there a way this can be immediately enforced on all users without manually manipulating the database?

This is a result of the security vulnerability notification of 8.5.2013. Customers desire a way to force all users to change passwords. This specific case prompted by a Confluence instance backed by crowd. Setting the requiresPasswordChange field to true in the database for all confluence directory users does not prompt Confluence users to change their password on login. It shows failed authentication error.
fields.summary: Force password reset for all users
